question: [File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/processor_status.rs] [Database: upsert operation] [Primary key collision] Is the processor field truly unique as a primary key, or can hash collisions or Unicode issues cause multiple processors to map to the same key? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/processor_status.rs] [Database: upsert operation] [Partial failure] If the upsert operation fails after updating last_success_version but before updating last_updated, can this cause monitoring systems to incorrectly report processor health? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/processor_status.rs] [Field: last_success_version] [Version gap] Can an indexer skip versions by updating last_success_version non-sequentially, causing missing data in the indexed blockchain state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/processor_status.rs] [Field: last_success_version] [Version rollback attack] Can a malicious indexer operator rollback last_success_version to reprocess old transactions and manipulate indexed data like token balances or NFT ownership? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/processor_status.rs] [Field: last_success_version] [Integer boundary] What happens when last_success_version approaches i64::MAX - can this cause crashes or undefined behavior in version arithmetic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/processor_status.rs] [Field: last_success_version] [Signed overflow] Since last_success_version is signed i64, can processing very large version numbers cause signed integer overflow leading to negative version tracking? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/processor_status.rs] [Field: last_success_version] [Off-by-one] When adding 1 to last_success_version to get the next start version, can off-by-one errors cause reprocessing or skipping of boundary transactions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/processor_status.rs] [Field: last_success_version] [Monotonicity violation] Are there checks ensuring last_success_version only increases, or can bugs allow it to decrease and corrupt indexer state consistency? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/processor_status.rs] [Diesel: AsChangeset] [Update injection] Can the AsChangeset derive macro be exploited to update unintended columns if the struct is modified or used in unsafe update contexts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/processor_status.rs] [Diesel: Insertable] [Batch insertion] If multiple ProcessorStatusV2 records are inserted in a batch, can partial failures leave the database in an inconsistent state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/processor_status.rs] [Diesel: Queryable] [Deserialization] Can malformed database data cause ProcessorStatusV2Query deserialization to panic, crashing the indexer process? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/processor_status.rs] [Diesel: table_name] [Schema mismatch] If the processor_status table schema changes but the Rust struct is not updated, can this cause silent data corruption or type confusion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/processor_status.rs] [Diesel: filter] [Query optimization] Can the filter().first() query pattern cause full table scans if indexes are missing, leading to performance degradation as processor count grows? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/processor_status.rs] [Diesel: optional] [Error suppression] Does .optional() hide genuine database errors by converting them to None, making it hard to detect actual database failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/processor_status.rs] [Field: processor] [Length validation] Is the processor name length validated against the database VARCHAR(50) constraint before insertion, preventing truncation attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/processor_status.rs] [Field: processor] [Special characters] Can processor names contain special characters like semicolons, quotes, or backslashes that break SQL queries or logging systems? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/processor_status.rs] [Field: processor] [Enumeration attack] Can an attacker enumerate all active processors by trying different processor names, potentially identifying critical system components to target? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/processor_status.rs] [Field: processor] [Namespace collision] Are processor names globally unique, or can different indexer instances create conflicting processor entries in shared databases? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/processor_status.rs] [Field: processor] [Reserved names] Are there reserved processor names (like 'system', 'admin', 'all') that should be blocked to prevent privilege escalation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/processor_status.rs] [Concurrency: read-modify-write] [TOCTOU] Can a time-of-check-to-time-of-use race occur between reading last_success_version and updating it, causing lost updates? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/processor_status.rs] [Concurrency: multiple processors] [State inconsistency] If multiple processor instances with the same name run concurrently, can their competing updates cause version inconsistencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/processor_status.rs] [Concurrency: database locks] [Deadlock] Can SELECT FOR UPDATE locks on processor_status rows cause deadlocks with other database operations, halting all indexer progress? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/processor_status.rs] [Concurrency: connection pool] [Resource starvation] Can long-running queries on processor_status starve other operations of database connections from the pool? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/processor_status.rs] [Error: QueryResult] [Error propagation] Are database errors from get_by_processor() properly propagated to callers, or can they be silently ignored leading to incorrect indexer behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/processor_status.rs] [Error: connection failure] [Retry logic] If the database connection fails during status query/update, can infinite retries cause resource exhaustion or amplify cascading failures? (Medium)
